children.subject: **UPDATE 4/18:  To be able to implement this, we will have to create a faux discussion and/or lab section that will be offered at no particular time and in no particular room that all students who enroll in CS 1xx will select.  The actual sections at specific times in specific locations will still exist at classes.berkeley.edu but not in calcentral.  The faux section will create no conflicts and it will have at least as many seats as the lecture so the waitlist can still be processed in lecture waitlist order.  It should be possible to enroll in any non-cross-listed CS course starting between 9am and noon on Wednesday 4/19.

A few quick additional things related to enrollments:

1)  Beginning for Fall 17, I will no longer be managing enrollments (or managing Soda Hall classrooms and conference rooms and alcoves).  Cindy Conners is taking that over and you'll begin to see her post more on more on this forum. She's great. We're all really lucky she's taking this on. Individual enrollment related emails should start going to her @ csconners

@berkeley.edu
2) We haven't set up EE/CS conflict forms yet. We will. Info will be posted on piazza. For CS classes, we will begin processing them starting in phase 2.
3) Remember: As soon as any student adds to the wait list of a particular course (say a non-major for a CS upper div) all students who try to enroll in that class (including student who should be able to enroll) are prompted to add to the wait list. Then, when the wait list process runs (every morning and every evening), students who do qualify to enroll in the class are enrolled. The class will then open back up and students who meet the reserve cap will be able to enroll until another student adds to the wait list.
Followup: are non-declared CS majors allowed to enroll directly in DS 100 during Phase I/II?
What "8" means is that any more information about enrollments into that course should be sought from the Stat department.  Nothing I said above about CS upper divs necessarily applies.
Thanks for the update! Will CS majors be able to enroll directly in DS 100/STAT C100 during Phase 1 as well?

If you make the 3.3 gpa in the necessary classes, it will almost certainly work out.  If you fall below 3.3 and want to appeal, the "purge" will likely happen before your appeal is processed and you will not remain on the waitlist.

CalCentral and EE/CS conflict forms are separate. I believe EE/CS forms were to provide students with more options by letting them pick multiple sections for a class they wanted to enroll in but had a conflict with.

If the Calcentral form will work for you, go for it.  The EE/CS conflict forms were created because the Calcentral forms proved to be mostly useless as students reported their experiences. In some situations, I believe they might be helpful.

NOTE:  Webcasting will not resolve potential final exam conflicts which are completely your responsibility.

This is the Fa2017 thread. Try @9147

Hi, I'm a Data Science major, trying to enroll in CS W186 and CS 188 for Fall 2019. Since I'm not EECS or CS, naturally I'm on the waitlist, but I've been told that both classes will open back up during adjustment period. Will I still be purged from the waitlist at the end of Phase 1? And during adjustment period, what are my chances of getting into the class since I'm declared Data Science?

history.content:
1)   In phase 1 and Phase 2, all declared CS/EECS majors will be able to enroll directly into upper division CS courses assuming space is available. Note:  We will still only enroll up to 70% of estimated final class capacity until (U)GSI hiring is finalized enough that we are sure the instructional staff can support higher enrollments in that particular class.

2)    Non-majors will not be able to enroll during phase 1 or phase 2 (same as before).  They will only be able to waitlist.  Those non-majors who waitlist during phase 1 will be dropped from the waitlist at the end of phase 1.  We will wait until major declarations (not necessarily appeals but the first round of approvals) have been processed before we purge the waitlist of non-majors.

Non-majors will be able to enroll into upper division classes during the adjustment period (space permitting).

3)  For all upper division CS classes in F17, students will use calcentral to enroll in the lecture and not to choose discussion sections.  Discussion sections still exist and will be visible in classes.berkeley.edu .  Since these sections won’t automatically show up in schedule planner, etc., students can manually block off a specific discussion section time in their schedule as desired.  This change was made to avoid students being bumped to the end of the lecture waitlist when changing sections for a waitlisted course. The instructor is likely to speak briefly during the first lecture about discussion section attendance.  Basically, as long as fire code isn’t ignored you’ll probably be good.  

**UPDATE 4/18:  To be able to implement this, we will have to create a faux discussion and/or lab section that will be offered at no particular time and in no particular room that all students who enroll in CS 1xx will select.  The actual sections at specific times in specific locations will still exist at classes.berkeley.edu but not in calcentral.  The faux section will create no conflicts and it will have at least as many seats as the lecture so the waitlist can still be processed in lecture waitlist order.  It should be possible to enroll in any non-cross-listed CS course starting between 9am and noon on Wednesday 4/19.

**UPDATE 4/20:   CS162 should be fixed now. Campus has removed the inaccurate requirement to sign up for a lab.

4)   Enrollment (and waitlist) is blocked for CS188 until we are certain a qualified instructor can be found.  Enrollment for 195 is similarly blocked but only until the schedule is settled (in the next few days we hope).  I believe hiring is in process for lecturers for 161 and 160 so enrollments for those classes will proceed normally.

**UPDATE 7/19: CS 188 will be taught. Prof Satish Rao (likely with a co-instructor) will teach.  The class will be open for enrollment sometime between tomorrow (Thursday) morning and the next morning (Friday).

5)  CS184 has been cancelled for F17 since we could not find an instructor.

6)  CS 162 and 169 are Early Drop Deadline courses.  This means that students who are enrolled and want to drop have to do by no later than end of week 2 (Sept 1 in F17) or they’ll need to get a Dean’s permission to override.  This is done so teams aren’t left in the lurch if one of their members abandons the class late.

7)  See cs169.saas-class.org for special enrollment procedures for CS169; short-version: students need to waitlist via calcentral and then enroll in  groups of 3 students each via an app that will be linked to the preceding website by Monday evening (4/17/17). (Two groups of three will be combined once the semester begins to make teams of 6).

8) DS 100 (aka COMPSCI c100/STAT c100) enrollments are being coordinated by STAT and will all be funneled through the STAT section.  No student will be able to enroll via CS c100.

history.content:
1)   In phase 1 and Phase 2, all declared CS/EECS majors will be able to enroll directly into upper division CS courses assuming space is available. Note:  We will still only enroll up to 70% of estimated final class capacity until (U)GSI hiring is finalized enough that we are sure the instructional staff can support higher enrollments in that particular class.

2)    Non-majors will not be able to enroll during phase 1 or phase 2 (same as before).  They will only be able to waitlist.  Those non-majors who waitlist during phase 1 will be dropped from the waitlist at the end of phase 1.  We will wait until major declarations (not necessarily appeals but the first round of approvals) have been processed before we purge the waitlist of non-majors.

Non-majors will be able to enroll into upper division classes during the adjustment period (space permitting).

3)  For all upper division CS classes in F17, students will use calcentral to enroll in the lecture and not to choose discussion sections.  Discussion sections still exist and will be visible in classes.berkeley.edu .  Since these sections won’t automatically show up in schedule planner, etc., students can manually block off a specific discussion section time in their schedule as desired.  This change was made to avoid students being bumped to the end of the lecture waitlist when changing sections for a waitlisted course. The instructor is likely to speak briefly during the first lecture about discussion section attendance.  Basically, as long as fire code isn’t ignored you’ll probably be good.  

**UPDATE 4/18:  To be able to implement this, we will have to create a faux discussion and/or lab section that will be offered at no particular time and in no particular room that all students who enroll in CS 1xx will select.  The actual sections at specific times in specific locations will still exist at classes.berkeley.edu but not in calcentral.  The faux section will create no conflicts and it will have at least as many seats as the lecture so the waitlist can still be processed in lecture waitlist order.  It should be possible to enroll in any non-cross-listed CS course starting between 9am and noon on Wednesday 4/19.

**UPDATE 4/20:   CS162 should be fixed now. Campus has removed the inaccurate requirement to sign up for a lab.

4)   Enrollment (and waitlist) is blocked for CS188 until we are certain a qualified instructor can be found.  Enrollment for 195 is similarly blocked but only until the schedule is settled (in the next few days we hope).  I believe hiring is in process for lecturers for 161 and 160 so enrollments for those classes will proceed normally.

**UPDATE 7/19: CS 188 will be taught. Prof Satish Rao (likely with a co-instructor) will teach.  The class will be open for enrollment sometime between tomorrow (Thursday) morning and the next morning (Friday).

5)  CS184 has been cancelled for F17 since we could not find an instructor.

6)  CS 162 and 169 are Early Drop Deadline courses.  This means that students who are enrolled and want to drop have to do by no later than end of week 2 (Sept 1 in F17) or they’ll need to get a Dean’s permission to override.  This is done so teams aren’t left in the lurch if one of their members abandons the class late.

7)  See cs169.saas-class.org for special enrollment procedures for CS169; short-version: students need to waitlist via calcentral and then enroll in  groups of 3 students each via an app that will be linked to the preceding website by Monday evening (4/17/17). (Two groups of three will be combined once the semester begins to make teams of 6).

8) DS 100 (aka COMPSCI c100/STAT c100) enrollments are being coordinated by STAT and will all be funneled through the STAT section.  No student will be able to enroll via CS c100.

1)   In phase 1 and Phase 2, all declared CS/EECS majors will be able to enroll directly into upper division CS courses assuming space is available. Note:  We will still only enroll up to 70% of estimated final class capacity until (U)GSI hiring is finalized enough that we are sure the instructional staff can support higher enrollments in that particular class.

2)    Non-majors will not be able to enroll during phase 1 or phase 2 (same as before).  They will only be able to waitlist.  Those non-majors who waitlist during phase 1 will be dropped from the waitlist at the end of phase 1.  We will wait until major declarations (not necessarily appeals but the first round of approvals) have been processed before we purge the waitlist of non-majors.

Non-majors will be able to enroll into upper division classes during the adjustment period (space permitting).

3)  For all upper division CS classes in F17, students will use calcentral to enroll in the lecture and not to choose discussion sections.  Discussion sections still exist and will be visible in classes.berkeley.edu .  Since these sections won’t automatically show up in schedule planner, etc., students can manually block off a specific discussion section time in their schedule as desired.  This change was made to avoid students being bumped to the end of the lecture waitlist when changing sections for a waitlisted course. The instructor is likely to speak briefly during the first lecture about discussion section attendance.  Basically, as long as fire code isn’t ignored you’ll probably be good.  

**UPDATE 4/18:  To be able to implement this, we will have to create a faux discussion and/or lab section that will be offered at no particular time and in no particular room that all students who enroll in CS 1xx will select.  The actual sections at specific times in specific locations will still exist at classes.berkeley.edu but not in calcentral.  The faux section will create no conflicts and it will have at least as many seats as the lecture so the waitlist can still be processed in lecture waitlist order.  It should be possible to enroll in any non-cross-listed CS course starting between 9am and noon on Wednesday 4/19.

**UPDATE 4/20:   CS162 should be fixed now. Campus has removed the inaccurate requirement to sign up for a lab.

4)   Enrollment (and waitlist) is blocked for CS188 until we are certain a qualified instructor can be found.  Enrollment for 195 is similarly blocked but only until the schedule is settled (in the next few days we hope).  I believe hiring is in process for lecturers for 161 and 160 so enrollments for those classes will proceed normally.

**UPDATE 7/19: CS 188 will be taught. Prof Satish Rao (likely with a co-instructor) will teach.  The class will be open for enrollment sometime between tomorrow (Thursday) morning and the next morning (Friday).

5)  CS184 has been cancelled for F17 since we could not find an instructor.

6)  CS 162 and 169 are Early Drop Deadline courses.  This means that students who are enrolled and want to drop have to do by no later than end of week 2 (Sept 1 in F17) or they’ll need to get a Dean’s permission to override.  This is done so teams aren’t left in the lurch if one of their members abandons the class late.

7)  See cs169.saas-class.org for special enrollment procedures for CS169; short-version: students need to waitlist via calcentral and then enroll in  groups of 3 students each via an app that will be linked to the preceding website by Monday evening (4/17/17). (Two groups of three will be combined once the semester begins to make teams of 6).

8) DS 100 (aka COMPSCI c100/STAT c100) enrollments are being coordinated by STAT and will all be funneled through the STAT section.  No student will be able to enroll via CS c100.
